Author: jl777c#5810
Content: PIRATE only helps KMD privacy, seems to be bringing in attention to KMD from miners

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with PIRATE short of announcing that you just did a transaction, it will be difficult to even know if you did a transaction, let alone when. and even if you do, it wont leak info about the counterparty to the transaction. (unless it was a coinbase -> z). these z->z transactions just have no info to latch onto. even a noob wont be able to leak info (other than timing and txid)

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: yes, as i said, if one properly gets in and only SPENDS, fine

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what is the leakage if one gets in improperly?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and how do you get in improperly? even with an announced purchase from a taddr, you end up with zfunds and at some later date is transferred and that transfer wont be able to be correlated, short of a public post of the details

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: what is the leakage if i do t->z and then z->z?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, who can link the final z to the original t?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it sounds like you think there is a leakage and if so I want to fix it. i dont see the leakage of privacy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the z-> z breaks the links and most all PIRATE tx are z->z

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: what is the leakage if i only spend to z?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I mean how does anybody even know what txid the z-> z was?

Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: exactly, can do same thing, especially when n00bs use PEX!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, so you dont see an attack vector then
